description: The Northwestern University Marching Band practices for upcoming Northwestern University Wildcats' games. The band practices marching, formations, cheers, and rehearses for performances including "Go U Northwestern." To celebrate band director Stephen Peterson's engagement, the band members drop him in Lake Michigan. Following the footage of band camp is a recording of "New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh," "Ghostbusters," and "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles." After the cartoons is a recording of "Bears '89 with Dan Hampton."

description: A compilation of Northwestern University Marching Band performances during the 1994-1995 Northwestern Wildcats football season. First are performances from the Northwestern Wildcats versus the Michigan State Spartans at Dyche Stadium and includes "Fanfare," "America the Beautiful," and the National Anthem. Second are performances from another home football game including performances by the Cheer Team to "Celebration," and a Motown medley of "I heard it through the grapevine," "Respect," and "When a man loves a woman," "Stop in the name of love," "My girl," "Dancing in the street," and "A-B-C." Performances from the High School Band Day featuring a medley from Jurassic Park, John Philip Sousa's "The Washington Post" march, "Trumpet voluntary," "Shenandoah," and "Battle Hymn of the Republic." Next are a group of performances including "Got to get you into my life," Chicago's "I just wanna be free," and Paul Simon's "Late in the evening." The next performances features songs from Leonard Bernstein's West Side Story including "Mambo," "Tonight," and "America." The final performance includes "Firebird" by Igor Stravinsky. The NU Marching Band was conducted by Stephen G. Peterson and Matthew Ludwig.

description: Part Three of the Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1980 Drum Corp International Championship from Birmingham, Alabama. Jim Peck, Steve Rondinaro, and Rita Moreno host the televised coverage of performances by the top 12 corps. The 12 corps will be judged on horn line, drum line, and color guard. Part 3 features three corps performances. The Santa Clara Vanguard from California perform "The Planets," selections from "Evita," including "Don't Cry For Me Argentina," and others. The Madison Scouts from Wisconsin perform the "Entre Act" from "They're Playing Our Song," "Malagueña," "New Country," and music from the movie "Ice Castles." The Phantom Regiment from Rockford, Illinois perform "Russian Easter Overture," "Polovtsian Dances," "The Gallop," and "Carmen Suite."  WTTW Channel 11 interrupts the coverage with station identification and sponsorship information.

description: Part Two of the Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1980 Drum Corp International Championship from Birmingham, Alabama. Jim Peck, Steve Rondinaro, and Rita Moreno host the televised coverage of performances by the top 12 corps. The 12 corps will be judged on horn line, drum line, and color guard. Part 2 features the conclusion of the Guardsmen from Schaumburg-Hoffman Estates performance of "The Wasps" and "Greensleeves." The Garfield Cadets from New Jersey perform "One Voice," "Uncle Joe," "Fantasy," "Elk's Parade," and music from the movie "Ice Castles." The Cavaliers from Park Ridge, Illinois perform a selection of music including "Santa Esmeralda Suite." The Crossmen from Pennsylvania perform "Pictures of Spain," "Spanish Fantasy," music from the movie "Superman," and others. WTTW Channel 11 interrupts the coverage with station identification and sponsorship information.

creator: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
description: Pregame and half-time performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats home game against the Rutgers Scarlet Knights at Dyche Stadium. Conducted by Stephen G. Peterson, the pregame performances include "God Bless America," "Go U Northwestern," and the National Anthem. The Northwestern University Marching band begins the halftime show with "Chimes Festival." High school marching bands from the Illinois area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on High School Band Day. Don Owens conducts the bands for John Philip Sousa's "Manhattan Beach March," and Peterson conducts Tchaikovsky's "1812 Overture." John P. Paynter conducts the NU marching band and high school bands for "Alma Mater." Then the Northwestern Marching Band performs the pregame show for a Chicago Cubs game at Wrigley Field in Chicago, Illinois. The band performs "Go U Northwestern," "You are the Sunshine of My Life," "La Fiesta," and "Chimes Festival." Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

description: Pregame and half-time performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the Indiana University Hoosiers in Bloomington, Indiana. Conducted by Stephen G. Peterson, the pregame performances include "Fanfare," "God Bless America," and "Go U Northwestern." The Indiana University Marching Band performs "IU Fanfare," "God Bless America," "Indiana Fight," and "Chimes of Indiana." John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem. Northwestern University Marching Band's halftime show has a jazz theme and features performances of "You are the Sunshine of My Life," "La Fiesta," and "South Rampart Street Parade." The Indiana University Marching Band's halftime show features songs from across the world including "Can-Can" and ""Malagueña." from Rossini's "Barber of Seville," Leoncavallo's "Pagliacci," Puccini's "Turandot," and Rossini's "William Tell Overture." Paynter conducts the marching band for "Alma Mater." Then the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the Ohio State Buckeyes at Dyche Stadium. Conducted by Stephen G. Peterson, the pregame performances include "God Bless America," "Go U Northwestern,"and the National Anthem. The halftime show features performances of "La Fiesta," "Appalachian Spring," and "March of the Steelmen." Senior members are honored and John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater." Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Lonis, Dale|Paynter, John P.|Williams, Clifton, 1923-1976|Harnick, Sheldon
description: Band-O-Rama features highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1984 season. The event begins with John P. Paynter conducting the National Anthem. The marching band, conducted by Dale Lonis, performs other universities' fight songs, "Wildcat Fantasy," "Go U Northwestern," "Ghostbusters," "1984 Olympic Fanfare, "The Kick-off," "California Dreaming," "Everything's Coming Up Roses," "Memory," "Sinfonians," "I Can't Stand Dragons," "On Broadway," "Sunrise, Sunset," and "Strike Up the Band." Lonis addresses the audience and thanks band leaders. Performances continue with "Malagueña," "Take the A Train," "Night in Tunisha," and Harlem Nocturne." Senior members of the band are acknowledged and "March of the Steelmen" is performed. Finally, John P. Paynter shares some final remarks and conducts "Alma Mater."

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Lonis, Dale|Williams, Clifton, 1923-1976|Paynter, John P.|Jones, Quincy, 1933-|Owens, Don (Don D.)
description: Three performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1982 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Michigan Wolverines at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include the National Anthem, "America the Beautiful," "42nd Street," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "New York, New York," "Give My Regards to Broadway," "On Broadway," "Somewhere," and "Alma Mater. Postgame performances include "Hail to the Victors," "Go U Northwestern," "Sinfonians," "42nd Street," and "Alma Mater." Footage of the end of the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Minnesota Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois follow. The Northwestern University Marching Band then performs a postgame show including "Go U Northwestern" and "Minnesota Rouser." The NUMB alums join the band to perform "When the Saints Go Marching In." The final performances are from a Northwestern Wildcats game against the Michigan State Spartans in East Lansing, Michigan. Pregame selections from Northwestern include "MSU Fight Song" and "Go U Northwestern. The Spartan Marching Band performs "MSU Fight Song," "Only Time Will Tell," "Go U Northwestern," "MSU Shadows," and "God Bless America." John P. Paynter then conducts the National Anthem. Northwestern's halftime performance was space-themed and included "Space Invaders" and "Go U Northwestern." Local high school bands join the Spartan Marching Band for a halftime performance that includes "Even the Nights Are Better," "Ai No Corrida," "Through the Years," and the "MSU Fight Song." Scenes from a Northwestern Marching Band practice at Dyche Stadium follow the game against Michigan State.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Ohio State Buckeyes in Columbus, Ohio. The pregame performances include "(Fight the Team) Across the Field," "Mack the Knife," and "Go U Northwestern." John P. Paynter conducts the Ohio State Marching Band in the National Anthem. Halftime performances include "Hey Look Me Over" and "Hello Dolly." The Ohio State Marching Band's halftime performances include "Do You Know the Way To San Jose," "My Kind of Town," "Talk to the Animals," and "Call Me."

description: Footage of conductor John P. Paynter in rehearsals for Northwestern University's Waa-Mu production. The Waa-Mu Show is Northwestern University’s own original musical, written, performed, and presented by Northwestern students. The Waa-Mu Show’s name stands for the two organizations that banded together to present the first show in 1929, the Women’s Athletic Association (W.A.A.) and the Men’s Union (M.U.).

description: Northwestern Wildcats play the Tennessee Volunteers in the 1997 Citrus Bowl in Orlando, Florida. Footages includes scenes of the Northwestern University Marching Band preparing for the performance. Practices and other performances from the 1996-1997 season are included. The pregame performance begins with "Go U Fanfare." Director of Bands, Mallory Thompson then conducts "Alma Mater," and "Go U Northwestern" is performed. The halftime show features the Color Guard and Percussion Ensemble performing "Malagueña." Gary Barnett and Stephen Peterson thank band members for their work during the season and "Alma Mater" is performed.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats home opener against the Miami University RedHawks at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Go U Fanfare" and "Miami Fight Song." Stephen Peterson conducts "America the Beautiful," and John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem. The pregame concludes with "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance features a "Blues Brothers" medley including "Everybody Needs Somebody To Love," "Gimme Some Lovin'" "Sweet Home Chicago," and "Think." John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the University of Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Go U Fanfare" and "On, Wisconsin." Stephen Peterson conducts "America the Beautiful." John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem and "Go U Northwestern" is performed. The halftime performance has a World War II theme and includes John Williams' "March from 1941," a big band medley that includes "I'll Be Seeing You," "Don't Sit Under the Apple Tree," and Don't Get Around Much Anymore." The NUMB Alums join the band on the field for "Sing, Sing, Sing" and John Philip Sousa's "The Stars and Stripes Forever." John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

creator: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the Michigan State University Spartans at Dyche Stadium. Conducted by Dale J. Lonis, the pregame performances include "America the Beautiful," "Gonna Fly Now," Go U Northwestern," and the National Anthem. The halftime performances include "Conquistador," "El Gato Triste," and "Grooving Hard." A tribute to the senior members of the band is made and "March of the Steelmen" is performed on the last home game of the regular season. Finally, John P. Paynter conducts the NU marching band for "Alma Mater." Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

creator: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
description: Northwestern University School of Music presents the Second Annual Hoffnung Festival, a humorous take on concert performances. The festival is named after Gerard Hoffnung, am artist, musician, cartoonist, tuba player, impresario, broadcaster and raconteur, known for his "Hoffnung Festivals" in London, at which classical music was spoofed for comic effect. Northwestern University's own Hoffnung Festival is hosted by Chicago Tribune's Theatre and Dance critic Linda Winer and by Chicago Tribune's Music critic John von Rhein and features humorous spoofs of classical music by Northwestern students. The performance by Northwestern University Symphony Orchestra is conducted by Robert Marcellus. The final performance by the Northwestern University Symphonic Wind Ensemble features three vacuums, a floor cleaner, and four rifles. Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Michigan State Spartans at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the pregame performances include "Victory for MSU," "Simple Gifts," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances follow a Halloween theme and include "Batman," "Sorcerer's Apprentice," and "Night on Bald Mountain. The NUMB alums join the marching band for the presentation of the Sudler Trophy. The Sudler Trophy is an award given to one university marching band by the John Philip Sousa Foundation. It was awarded annually from 1982 to 2007 and biannually since then. After the presentation of the Sudler Award, the NUMB alums join the Northwestern University Marching band to perform "Go U Northwestern." John P. Paynter then conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1974 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Halftime performances include "Yesterday," "Those Were the Days," "Gypsy Love Song," "Parade of the Wooden Soldiers," "Ain't We Got Fun," and "April in Paris." The Homecoming Court is announced as Stevie Wonder's "You Are the Sunshine of My Life" is performed. The band performs "March of the Steelmen" as a tribute to the late Glenn Cliff Bainum. Finally, "Alma Mater" is performed. The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Halftime performances include "Shall We Dance," "One o'Clock Jump," "Artistry in Rhythm," "Opus One," "Malagueña," "Rock Around the Clock," "Bunny Hop," and "Hello Dolly."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Air Force Falcons football team at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "God Bless America, " the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The United States Airforce Academy Cadets are featured during halftime. Performances include "Plank of Sound," "Radar," "Alexander's Ragtime Band," and "Off We Go Into the Wild Blue Yonder." Scenes of the Northwestern Marching Band playing in the stands follow the halftime performance of the Airforce Cadets.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs during at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Michigan State Spartans at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums from begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Dale Lonis, perform "Victory for MSU,  the National Anthem,  and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "Get It On" and "Mambo." The NUMB Alums from 1930-1985 join the current Northwestern University Marching Band for "Strike Up the Band." Members of the 1962 Northwestern Wildcat Football team are honored and coach Ara Parseghian speaks to the crowd. Finally, John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Army Cadets football team at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale J. Lonis, the pregame performances include "Go U Northwestern," "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, and "Sing, Sing, Sing." High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a halftime performance that includes "Conquistador." Jazz trumpeter Maynard Ferguson joins the bands for a performance of "Gonna Fly Now." Finally, John P. Paynter conducts the NU marching band and high school bands for a finale that includes "America the Beautiful" and "Alma Mater." Postgame performances also included.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the Minnesota Gophers in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include "Go U Northwestern" and "Wildcat Fantasy." The halftime performance theme was a salute to heroes and included the "1984 Olympic Fanfare" and the "Theme to Shaft." The performances from Minnesota were recorded over a televised Big 10 Section special about marching bands and that content is interspersed in between the performances. Also included is a performance of "Sing, Sing, Sing" by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the halftime performance of a football game against the Indiana Hoosiers. Marching band content is followed by about 20 minutes of daytime television and then recordings from a conducting class.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Purdue Boilermakers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The Purdue All American Marching Band begins the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern" and "Hail Purdue." Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the pregame performances include "Hail Purdue," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and  "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances by the Purdue All American Marching Band include "Chimes Festival," "Johnny Be Goode," "Firedance," and the finale of the "1812 Overture." The Northwestern Marching Band's halftime performances include "March of the Steelmen" and "Alma Mater."

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Peterson, Stephen (Conductor)|Paynter, John P.|Owens, Don (Don D.)|Ellington, Duke, 1899-1974
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1988 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Indiana Fight," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance begins with "This Could be the Start of Something Big."  High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a halftime performance that includes "76 Trombones," "Trumpet Voluntary," "Shenandoah," and "Battle Hymn of the Republic." John P. Paynter conducts the bands in "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums from 1930-1985 begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band continue the pregame performances with "On Wisconsin," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "Matchpoint" and Duke Ellington's "Caravan." The NUMB Alums join the band for "Yankee Production" and "Stars and Stripes Forever." John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Iowa Hawkeyes in Iowa City, Iowa. Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the pregame performances include "On, Iowa," "Simple Gifts," and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance featured songs from the musical "Miss Saigon" including "Bui Doi," "Heat Is On In Saigon," "American Dream," and "I Still Believe." The University of Iowa Marching Band's halftime performance includes "Final Countdown" and "China Grove." Following the game is footage of class in the Music Department of Northwestern University.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Lonis, Dale|Friedmann, Pete|Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
creator: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
description: Band-O-Rama features highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1986 season. Conducted by Dale Lonis, the performance begins with "America the Beautiful," "The Battle Hymm of the Republic," and the National Anthem.  The Northwestern Marching Band then performs other universities' fight songs, "Go U Northwestern," "Sing, Sing, Sing," music from "Shaft," and "Georgia on My Mind." The band then performs highlights from half-time shows throughout the 1986 season including "Conquistador" and "Gonna Fly Now." The Northwestern University Men's Glee Club performs a selection of songs. Selections from past halftime shows continues with "El Gato Triste," "Malagueña," "Bop Cheer," "Big Noise from Winnetka," "Sweet Georgia Brown," "It Don't Mean a Thing, If It Ain't Got That Swing," "Make Me Smile," "MacArthur Park," "Grooving Hard." The senior members of the band are then acknowledged, Lonis addresses the audience and thanks band leaders, and  "March of the Steelmen" is performed. Finally, John P. Paynter speaks about the spirit of the Northwestern University Marching Band, and then conducts the marching band for "Alma Mater."

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Lonis, Dale|Paynter, John P.|Friedmann, Pete|Jackson, Joe, 1954-|Williams, John, 1932-
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1984 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Iowa Hawkeyes in Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Before taking the field for the pregame performance, the band performs the National Anthem, "Go U Northwestern," "Ghostbusters," and "Alma Mater" inside Dyche Stadium.  Pregame performances continue on the football field as the University of Iowa Marching Band performs "Iowa Fight Song" and "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band then performs the National Anthem, "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances by the University of Iowa Marching Band include "Pinball Wizard," Joe Jackson's "Target," and selections from "Jesus Christ Superstar." The theme for Northwestern's halftime performance was heroes and included the theme songs for "Perry Mason," "Shaft," and "Rocky." Sharlene Wells, Miss America 1985, joins the band for "Alma Mater."  Postgame performances from both bands include "Iowa Fight Song," "Go U Northwestern," "Rock Around the Clock/Stout-Hearted Men," and "1984 Olympic Fanfare." John P. Paynter then conducts "Alma Mater." The The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Minnesota Gophers in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Pregame performances by the Northwestern Marching Band include "Minnesota Rouser," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." The Minnesota Marching Band performs the National Anthem, "Battle Hymn of the Republic," and "Minnesota Rouser."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the University of Iowa Hawkeyes at Dyche Stadium. Conducted by Stephen G. Peterson, the pregame performances include "America the Beautiful," and "Go U Northwestern." The National Anthem is conducted by University of Iowa's Myron Welch. The halftime performance includes "My Favorite Things," "March of the Steelmen," and a tribute to the senior members of the band on the last home game of the regular season. John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana University Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The Indiana University Marching Band's pregame performances include "IU Fanfare," "Yankee Doodle Dandy," and "You're a Grand Old Flag." Pregame performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band include the National Anthem, "Go U Northwestern," "America the Beautiful," and the "Theme from Shaft." Indiana University Marching Band's halftime performance features selections from West Side Story such as "Gee Officer Krupke," "Mambo," and "Somewhere." Northwestern University Marching Band's halftime performances include "Conquistador," "El Gato Triste," and "Malagueña."

description: Advertisement for the Northwestern University Marching Band's CD. Uncut clips include a baby dancing to the song "Hey Baby," Pez dispensers dancing to "When a Man Loves a Woman," "Tarzan Boy," "Jurassic Park theme," an interpretation of "Firebird Ballet Suite," and other skits advertising the recording. Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

description: Band-O-Rama features highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1995 season. Stephen G. Peterson conducts "Fanfare" and "America the Beautiful." John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem. Matthew Ludwig conducts a performance of fight songs from Miami of Ohio, Air Force, Indiana University, University of Michigan, University of Wisconsin, Penn State, University of Iowa, and Northwestern University. Highlights of the 1995 NU Marching Band's halftime performance from the game against Miami of Ohio include "Blues Brothers theme," "Gimme Some Lovin," "Everybody Needs Somebody to :ove,"  "Sweet Home Chicago," and "Think." Members of Northwestern University Spirit Team lead the audience in some cheers. Highlights of the halftime performance from the game against Air Force include "My Favorite Things," "Seventy-six trombones," and "Can You Feel the Love Tonight." The percussion section then performs three cadences. Highlights of the halftime performance from the game against Indiana University include selections from Rossini's "Barber of Seville," Leoncavallo's "Pagliacci," Puccini's "Turandot," and Rossini's "William Tell Overture." Highlights of the halftime performance from the game against the University of Wisconsin include John Williams "March from 1914," a big band medley, Benny Goodman's "Sing, Sing, Sing," and John Philip Sousa's "The Stars and Stripes Forever." The band performs songs to encourage audience participation including "Go Cats Go," "Get Ready for This," "Tarzan Boy," "Einstein on the Beach," and Hey Baby." Highlights of the halftime performance from the game against Penn State include Beatles hits "Can't Buy Me Love," "All My Loving," "Eleanor Rigby," "Norwegian Wood," "Hard Day's Night," "Hey Jude," "Day Tripper," "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band," and "Twist and Shout." The senior members of the band are then acknowledged, Peterson addresses the audience, and  "March of the Steelmen" is performed. Finally, John P. Paynter speaks about the 1995 football season and then conducts the marching band for "Alma Mater." Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

description: Performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band at Soldier Field and Dyche Stadium. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs a halftime show at a Chicago Bears game at Soldier Field in Chicago, Illinois. The performance includes "You are the Sunshine of My Life," "La Fiesta," "South Rampart Street Parade," and "Go U Northwestern." Then the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats home game against the University of Iowa Hawkeyes at Dyche Stadium. The University of Iowa Marching Band performs a pregame show. Conducted by Stephen G. Peterson, the Northwestern University Marching Band's pregame performances include "God Bless America," "Go U Northwestern," and the National Anthem. The University of Iowa Marching Band's halftime show features the "Battle Hymn of the Republic" and "1812 Overture." The Northwestern University Marching Band's halftime show features a set of music from 20th century composers including Paul Hindemith's "March from Symphonic Metamorphosis," Leonard Bernstein's "Slava," and Aaron Copland's "Appalachian Spring."

description: Part Five of the Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1980 Drum Corp International Championship from Birmingham, Alabama. Jim Peck, Steve Rondinaro, and Rita Moreno host the televised coverage of performances by the top 12 corps. The 12 corps will be judged on horn line, drum line, and color guard. Part 5 features the Blue Devils from California performing "New York Fantasy," "Off the Line," "You Gotta Try," "Pegasus," "Free," "La Suerte de los Tontos," and "Pauper in Paradise." Members of all the bands assemble for the announcement of the Blue Devils from California as the winner of the championship. WTTW Channel 11 interrupts the coverage with station identification and sponsorship information.

School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Peterson, Stephen (Conductor)|Paynter, John P.|Wilson, Brian, 1942-|Berlin, Irving, 1888-1989|Rodgers, Richard, 1902-1979|Hammerstein, Oscar, II, 1895-1960|Britten, Benjamin, 1913-1976|LaBarbera, John, 1945-
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1990 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Duke Blue Devils at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the Northwestern University Marching Band's pregame performances include "Fight Blue Devils" and "God Bless America." John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern" is performed. The halftime performances include "California Dreaming," "Wipe Out," "Louie, Louie," "Shout," and songs by the Beach Boys including "Barbara Ann" and "Surfin' USA." John P. Paynter conducts the band in "Alma Mater," and the performance concludes with "Go U Northwestern." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Michigan State Spartans at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Victory for MSU," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime show featured highlights of the season's shows including "My Favorite Things," "Tiger of San Pedro," "Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra," and "March of the Steelmen." After the seniors are honored, the band performs "Alma Mater."

description: Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1979 Drum Corp International Championship from . Jim Peck and Steve Rondinaro host the televised coverage of performances. Four corps are featured on this recording. The corps are judged on horn line, drum line, and color guard. The Troopers from Wyoming perform "Variations on a Scene," "Aquarius," "Let the Sunshine In," "Ballad of Billy the Kid," "Hand Me Down That Can of Beans," and "Ectasy of Gold," The Chicago Cavaliers from Illinois perform a selection of music including "Fantasy." The Guardsmen from Schaumburg-Hoffman Estates perform a selection of songs including "Greensleeves." North Star from Massachusetts perform a selection of songs.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the Penn State Nittany Lions at Dyche Stadium. Conducted by Stephen G. Peterson and Matthew Ludwig, the pregame performances include "Fanfare," "America the Beautiful," "Go U Northwestern," and the National Anthem. Also included is a brief ceremony where NU coach Gary Barnett presents an honorary game ball to George and Peggy Price, parents of NU football player Marcel Price. The halftime performance is a Beatles tribute and features "Can't Buy Me Love," "All My Loving," "Eleanor Rigby," "Norwegian Wood," "Hard Day's Night," "Hey Jude," "Day Tripper," "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band," and "Twist and Shout." John P. Paynter conducts the marching band for "Alma Mater." Video includes the last five minutes of the football game that the Northwestern University Wildcats won. Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Lonis, Dale|Williams, John, 1932-
description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats game against the Minnesota Gophers in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance theme was a salute to heroes and included the "1984 Olympic Fanfare," "The Kick-off," and the "Theme to Shaft." The performances from Minnesota were recorded over a televised special about marching bands and that content is interspersed in between the performances.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The film begins with aerial footage of Evanston, Illinois and pregame preparations. The University of Wisconsin band begins the pregame performances with a variation on the "1812 Overture." As part of the Homecoming celebration, the NUMB Alums take the field in advance of the Northwestern University Marching Band. The NU Marching Band, conducted by Dale J. Lonis, perform "Go U Northwestern," "America the Beautiful," "Malagueña," and the National Anthem. Footage from a conducting class follows the marching band performance.

abstract: Bainum worked as a high school and junior college band instructor before becoming a professor of music, Director of Bands, and Director of the glee clubs at Northwestern University in 1926. Bainum retired in 1953. The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Boxes 1-12 and 22-27 of the collection are divided into ten series: Biographical, Correspondence, Northwestern University School of Music, Other Organizations, General, Sheet Music, Photographs, Reel-toReel Recordings, Movies, Oversize Scores, and Artifacts. An addition consists of boxes 13-21.
contributor: Paynter, John P.|Bainum, Glenn Cliffe|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)

scope_and_contents: The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Information about nearly all of his major career activities is documented in his papers.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Owens, Don (Don D.)|Paynter, John P.
description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Arkansas Razorbacks in Little Rock, Arkansas. The University of Arkansas halftime show features the music of composer John Williams with a performance of the theme from "Superman." Following the Northwestern vs. Arkansas game is a halftime performance by the Northwestern University Marching Band at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The band performs Duke Ellington's "Caravan," "Magic," and "Comin' For To Carry Me Home." John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Fighting Illini at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The pregame performances include "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, "Illinois Loyalty," "Sinfonians," and "Go U Northwestern." After the pregame show, two performances of "Alma Mater" are recorded. The second performance appears to be from the Northwestern vs. Illinois game on November 21, 1981.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The pregame performances include "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, "Viking March," "Sweet Georgia Brown," and "Go U Northwestern." Northwestern's halftime performance was space-themed and included "Space Invaders" and "Go U Northwestern." Ralph "Moon" Baker, a Northwestern football halfback, is honored for his posthumous induction into the College Football Hall of Fame. "Alma Mater" is performed to conclude the halftime show.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Fighting Illini at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale J. Lonis, the pregame performances include "Illinois Loyalty," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "Temptation," "El Gato Triste," and "March of the Steelmen." John P. Paynter conducts the band in "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Ohio State Buckeyes at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois.  The halftime show includes "Yesterday," "I Write the Songs," The theme from "Hollywood Squares" is played to introduce Paul Lynde. Alumni Sophie Ann Schwab performs "Home" from the Wiz. The Homecoming Court is announced as the band performs "Evergreen." The NUMB Alums join the band to perform "Those Were the Days " and "Alma Mater."

description: A behind-the-scenes look at preparations for the 1960 Northwestern University Marching Band season. Footage includes conductor John P. Paynter discussing fundamentals with band members, practice drills, and Paynter planning some of the Northwestern University Marching Band's most popular formations. Former conductor Glenn Cliffe Bainum wishes the band luck before their first performance. Highlights from that first performance include "Strike Up the Band," "Seventy-Six Trombones," a polka, "Relax," and "Do-Re-Mi." The performances also feature sibling twirlers Roger and Barbara Kurucz.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Lonis, Dale|Paynter, John P.
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1983 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include the National Anthem, "What a Feeling (Theme from Flashdance)," "She Works Hard for the Money," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime selections include a "Tribute to Freshmen," "Fame," and "I Gotta Be Me." John P. Paynter then conducts the band for "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Michigan Wolverines in Ann Arbor, Michigan. Pregame performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band include "She Works Hard for the Money" and "Go U Northwestern." The Michigan Marching Band performs songs from "Blues Brothers" and "Hail to the Victors." Halftime performances by Northwestern include a "Tribute to Freshmen" and "Give My Regards to Broadway." The Michigan Marching Band performs "What a Feeling (Theme from Flashdance)" and "When I'm With You." Both bands participate in a postgame show performing "Go U Northwestern," "Hail to the Victors," "Fame," "When I'm With You," "What a Feeling (Theme from Flashdance)," "She Works Hard for the Money," "Alma Mater," and others.

Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Lonis, Dale|Paynter, John P.|Friedmann, Pete|Williams, Clifton, 1923-1976|Harnick, Sheldon
description: Band-O-Rama features highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1984 season. The event begins with John P. Paynter conducting the National Anthem. The marching band, conducted by Dale Lonis, performs other universities' fight songs, "Wildcat Fantasy," "Go U Northwestern," "Ghostbusters," "1984 Olympic Fanfare, "The Kick-off," "California Dreaming," "Everything's Coming Up Roses," "Memory," "Sinfonians," "I Can't Stand Dragons," "On Broadway," "Sunrise, Sunset," and "Strike Up the Band." Lonis addresses the audience and thanks band leaders. Performances continue with "Malagueña," "Take the A Train," "Night in Tunisha," and Harlem Nocturne." Senior members of the band are acknowledged and "March of the Steelmen" is performed. Finally, John P. Paynter shares some final remarks and conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Highlights of the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1989 season. The pregame performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Ohio State Buckeyes in Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Performances include the Ohio State Buckeyes Fight Song, "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performances from the game against Rutgers include "Chimes Festival." High school marching bands from the Chicago area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a performances of "Manhattan Beach March" and the "1812 Overture." John P. Paynter conducts the bands in "Alma Mater." During the halftime show from a game against the Indiana Hoosiers, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs "You Are the Sunshine of My Life," "La Fiesta," and "South Rampart Street Parade." The Northwestern Marching Band performs "You Are the Sunshine of My Life," "La Fiesta," "South Rampart Street Parade," and "Go U Northwestern" at Soldier Field in Chicago, Illinois. During the halftime show from a game against the Iowa Hawkeyes, the Northwestern Marching Band performs "March for Symphonic Metamorphosis," "Slava," and "Appalachian Spring."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' home game against the Air Force Falcons at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Go U Fanfare," "U.S. Air Force/Wild Blue Yonder," and "America the Beautiful." Stephen Peterson conducts the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern" is performed. The halftime show begins with a performance of "My Favorite Things." High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area then join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for performances of "Seventy-six Trombones," songs from the film "Pocahontas," and "Can You Feel the Love Tonight." John P. Paynter conducts the bands for "Alma Mater."

creator: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
description: Bandorama features the Northwestern University Marching Band, Flag Corps, and Cheer Team. Conducted by Don Owens, Don Casey, graduate assistants Bruce Moss, Charles Herman, Dale Lonis, and Meg Mansfield, the band recreates halftime performances from the 1981 Northwestern University football season. Also conducting are Katherine (Kati) McKay, manager of bands, and Director of Bands John P. Paynter. Performances include universities' fight songs, "Sweet Georgia Brown," numerous songs by Duke Ellington  such as "Caravan," "Mood Indigo," "Take the A Train," and "It don't mean a thing (if it ain't got that swing)." Also included are performances of "Sinfonians" by Clifton Williams, "Does anybody really know what time it is?" and "Brotherhood of man." Katherine McKay, manager of bands, conducts a rendition of Earth, Wind, and Fire's "Fantasy." The program concludes with current hits like Billy Joel's "Just the way you are," "Bill Bailey," "National Anthem march," and "St. Louis Blues." The program concludes with Director of Bands, John P. Paynter conducting "Alma Mater." Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Ohio State Buckeyes at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The pregame performances include "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, "Across the Field," "Somewhere Over the Rainbow," "Ease On Down the Road," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "That's Entertainment," "Hooray for Hollywood," "There's No Business Like Show Business," "Cabaret," and "Brotherhood of Man." McLean Stevenson is announced as the Homecoming Grand Marshal. As the Homecoming Court is announced, the band plays "What I Did For Love." The NUMB Alums join the band for "When the Saints Go Marching In" and "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the University of Michigan Wolverines at Michigan Stadium in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The Northwestern University Marching Band's pregame performances include "Go U Fanfare," "Hail to the Victors," and "Go U Northwestern." The University of Michigan Marching Band's pregame performances include "Hail to the Victors" and "Go U Northwestern." John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem. The halftime performance by the Northwestern University Marching Band is an opera tribute and features selections from Rossini's "Barber of Seville," Puccini's "Turandot," and Rossini's "William Tell Overture." The University of Michigan Marching Band follows with their halftime show including performances of Aretha Franklin's "Think" and a version of Barbra Streisand's "Happy Days Are Here Again." John P. Paynter conducts both marching bands for the final halftime performance of Tchaikovsky's"1812 Overture."

abstract: Bainum worked as a high school and junior college band instructor before becoming a professor of music, Director of Bands, and Director of the glee clubs at Northwestern University in 1926. Bainum retired in 1953. The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Boxes 1-12 and 22-27 of the collection are divided into ten series: Biographical, Correspondence, Northwestern University School of Music, Other Organizations, General, Sheet Music, Photographs, Reel-toReel Recordings, Movies, Oversize Scores, and Artifacts. An addition consists of boxes 13-21.

scope_and_contents: The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Information about nearly all of his major career activities is documented in his papers.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Fighting Illini at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The recording begins with halftime performances of "There Is Nothing Like A Dame," "There's No Business Like Show Business," and "Sweet Georgia Brown." Clinton E. Frank then honors John Leo "Patty" Driscoll with a posthumous induction into the Football Hall of Fall. "Alma Mater" is performed and the band cheers from the sidelines. Then pregame performances include "America the Beautiful" and "Go U Northwestern." More performances from halftime include "The Entertainer," "Everything's Coming Up Roses," and the Mickey Mouse theme.

description: The Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Minnesota Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The University of Minnesota Marching Band's pregame performance features "Minnesota March" and "Minnesota Rouser." The Northwestern University Marching Band then performs "Minnesota Rouser," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The University of Minnesota Marching Band's halftime performances include "Lucretia Mac Evil" and "Get It On." The Northwestern University Marching Band's halftime performances include "You are the Sunshine of My Life" and "La Fiesta." The NUMB Alums join the band for "South Rampart Street Parade" and the premiere of the march "Here Come the NUMB Alums."

School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Gershwin, George, 1898-1937|Gershwin, Ira, 1896-1983|Lonis, Dale|Paynter, John P.|Owens, Don (Don D.)
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1985 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers in Bloomington, Indiana. Halftime performances include "You're a Grand Old Flag" and "Yankee Doodle Dandy" as part of a tribute to Indiana Hoosiers and "Sing, Sing, Sing." The Indiana Marching Band performs the music of George and Ira Gershwin including  "American in Paris ballet," "I've Got Rhythm," "Summertime," and "Oh Lord, I'm On My Way." Both bands participate in a postgame show featuring "Indiana Our Indiana," "Go U Northwestern," "I've Got Rhythm," "Theme from Shaft," "Summertime," "Oh Lord, I'm On My Way," and "Georgia On My Mind." John P. Paynter then conducts the Northwestern Marching Band for "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Minnesota Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums from 1930-1985 begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Dale Lonis, performs the National Anthem, "Minnesota Rouser," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern Homecoming performances include "Sing, Sing, Sing," Don Owens conducting the Vocal Jazz Ensemble in "Birdland," and the NUMB alums joining the marching band for "Bill Bailey Won't You Please Come Home." John P. Paynter then conducts Alma Mater. Postgame performances by the NU Marching Band include "Minnesota Rouser," "Go U Northwestern," "Yankee Doodle Dandy," "You're a Grand Old Flag," "When the Saints Go Marching In," "Fame," "Bill Bailey Won't You Please Come Home," and "Alma Mater."

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Lonis, Dale|Berlin, Irving, 1888-1989|Paynter, John P.
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1985 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against Northern Illinois Huskies at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include the National Anthem, "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a halftime performance that includes "Yankee Doodle Dandy," "You're a Grand Old Flag, " "Chimes of Liberty," and "God Bless America." John P. Paynter then conducts the bands for "Alma Mater." Postgame performances by the NU Marching Band include "Go U Northwestern," "Theme from Shaft," "Georgia On My Mind," and "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers in Bloomington, Indiana. Pregame performances include the National Anthem and "Go U Northwestern." Pregame performance by the NU Marching Band include "Indiana Our Indiana," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." The Indiana Marching Band performs "Indiana Our Indiana," "Go U Northwestern," and "Hail To Old IU." John P. Paynter then conducts the National Anthem.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the pregame performances include "On, Wisconsin," "Simple Gifts," the National Anthem and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance featured songs from the musical "Miss Saigon" including "Bui Doi," "Heat Is On In Saigon," "American Dream," and "I Still Believe." The theme from the movie "Batman" and "March of the Steelmen" are also performed at halftime. Senior members of the band are honored and then John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1988 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Michigan Wolverines at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Hail to the Victors," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include a tribute to the music of Duke Ellington with performances of "Things Ain't What They Used to Be," "Sophisticated Lady," "Satin Doll," "It Don't Mean a Thing (If It Ain't Got That Swing)," and "Take the A Train." John P. Paynter conducts the band in "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Notre Dame Fighting Irish at Soldier Field in Chicago, Illinois. Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the pregame performances include the "Notre Dame Victory March," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The Notre Dame Marching Band's halftime performance features "Fire Dance," "Whole Lotta  Shakin' Goin' On," and the "Notre Dame Victory March." The Northwestern University Marching Band's halftime performance includes "This Could Be the Start Of Something Big," "Wipe-Out," and "Shout." John P. Paynter then conducts the band in "Alma Mater."

title: Northwestern University Marching Band

abstract: Bainum worked as a high school and junior college band instructor before becoming a professor of music, Director of Bands, and Director of the glee clubs at Northwestern University in 1926. Bainum retired in 1953. The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Boxes 1-12 and 22-27 of the collection are divided into ten series: Biographical, Correspondence, Northwestern University School of Music, Other Organizations, General, Sheet Music, Photographs, Reel-toReel Recordings, Movies, Oversize Scores, and Artifacts. An addition consists of boxes 13-21.

scope_and_contents: The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Information about nearly all of his major career activities is documented in his papers.

description: Band-O-Rama features highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1989 season. Stephen G. Peterson conducts "Bop Cheer," and an alumni conducts "Sing, Sing, Sing." Peterson returns to conduct "My Kind of Town" and a series of cadences featuring the percussion section entitled "Street Beats." Next, the band performs a set of music from 20th century composers including Leonard Bernstein's "Slava," Paul Hindemith's "March from Symphonic Metamorphosis," and Aaron Copland's "Appalachian Spring." The senior members of the band are then acknowledged, Peterson addresses the audience and thanks band leaders, and  "March of the Steelmen" is performed. Finally, Peterson conducts the Marching Band in "Alma Mater." A recording of a rehearsal follows the conclusion of Bandorama.

description: Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1980 Drum Corp International Championship from Birmingham, Alabama.  Part 1 features four performances. The Bridgemen of New Jersey perform a circus themed selection, "Battle Hymn of the Republic," and others. The Spirit of Atlanta from Georgia perform "Georgia On My Mind," "Old Man River," "Sweet Georgia Brown," and "Let It Be Me." The 27th Lancers from Massachusetts perform a selection of songs.  The Blue Devils from California performing "New York Fantasy," "Off the Line," "You Gotta Try," "Pegasus," "Free," "La Suerte de los Tontos," and "Pauper in Paradise."

contributor: Cablevision of Chicago|Owens, Don (Don D.)|Winer, Linda|Von Rhein, John|Powell, Morgan, 1938-|Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
creator: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
description: Northwestern University Jazz Ensemble performs at Pick-Staiger Concert Hall in Evanston, Illinois. The event is hosted by Chicago Tribune Theatre and Dance critic, Linda Winer and Music critic, John von Rhein. Don Owens conducts the ensemble. Part One includes performances of "On Green Dolphin Street," "Intimacy of the Blues," "Groovin' Hard," "Bird Merchant," "Bill Bailey," and "Someday My Prince Will Come." Part One also features von Rhein's interview with Don Owens where Owens discusses his vision for the Northwestern University Jazz Ensemble, the role of improvisation in jazz, and the Morgan Powell piece "Bird Merchant." Part Two features performances of "I'm Old Fashioned," "Snapper," and "Mexicali Rose." Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, named for John Phillip Sousa, began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging. The John P. Paynter Collection consists of six series titled Biographical Materials, Office, Northwestern University "Wildcat" Marching Band (NUMB), Publications, Music, and Digital and Audio Visual Material.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Wake Forest Demon Deacons at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Stephen Peterson, the pregame performances include "Here's to Wake Forest" and "God Bless America." John P. Paynter conducts the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern" is performed. The Northwestern University Marching Band begins the halftime performances with "The Planets." High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a halftime performance that includes "National Emblem," and a medley honoring the different branches of the United States Armed Forces. John P. Paynter conducts the bands in his arrangement of "America the Beautiful," as the bands spell out "U.S.A." The performance concludes with "Alma Mater."

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Stephen Peterson, performs "On, Wisconsin," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "My Favorite Things" and "Tiger of San Pedro." The NUMB alums join the marching band for "Sing, Sing, Sing" and "Bill Bailey." John P. Paynter then conducts "Alma Mater." The Homecoming Court is then announced. Following the band performance is question and answer session with Branford Marsalis hosted by the Music Department of Northwestern University on November 1, 1990.

creator: Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.)
description: Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1979 Drum Corp International Championship from . Jim Peck and Steve Rondinaro host the televised coverage of performances. Four corps are featured on this recording. The corps are judged on horn line, drum line, and color guard. The Blue Stars from Wisconsin perform a selections of songs including "Strike Up the Band." The Bridgemen of New Jersey perform music from the opera "Pagliacci," "Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy," "Dixie" and others. The Madison Scouts of Wisconsin perform "Banner's Pickup Rifles," "Bohemian Rhapsody," "Bring Out a Smoothie," and "Pieces of Dreams." The 27th Lancers from Massachusetts perform a selection of songs including "When Johnny Comes Marching Home" and "Take Five."

creator: Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.)
description: Part Four of the Public Broadcasting Service's coverage of the 1980 Drum Corp International Championship from Birmingham, Alabama. Jim Peck, Steve Rondinaro, and Rita Moreno host the televised coverage of performances by the top 12 corps. The 12 corps will be judged on horn line, drum line, and color guard. Part 4 features three corps performances. The Bridgemen of New Jersey perform a circus themed selection, "Battle Hymn of the Republic," and others. The Spirit of Atlanta from Georgia perform "Georgia On My Mind," "Old Man River," "Sweet Georgia Brown," and "Let It Be Me." The 27th Lancers from Massachusetts perform a selection of songs. WTTW Channel 11 interrupts the coverage with station identification and sponsorship information.

School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Peterson, Stephen (Conductor)|Strauss, Richard, 1864-1949|Holst, Gustav, 1874-1934|Williams, John, 1942-|Berlin, Irving, 1888-1989|Kenton, Stan
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1991 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Purdue Boilermakers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Stephen Peterson, performs "Hail Purdue," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance has a outer space theme and includes "Theme from 2001: A Space Odyssey (Sprach Zarathustra)," "The Planets," and a medley from "Star Wars" and "The Empire Strikes Back." John P. Paynter conducts the band in "Alma Mater." Before the second game are scenes from a band practice in Dyche Stadium for a tribute to John P. Paynter on 40 years of service to the Music Department. The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Fighting Illini at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band performs the Illinois Fight Song, "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances begin with "Ya Gotta Try" and "La Suerte de los Tontos." NUMB alums from 1932-1991 join the marching band in a special surprise salute to John P. Paynter for 40 years of service as a faculty member in the Music Department. The combined band performs "Bill Bailey" and "People." John P. Paynter then conducts Alma Mater.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Ohio State Buckeyes in Cleveland, Ohio. The Ohio State University Marching Band begins the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern" and "Buckeye Battle Cry." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Stephen Peterson, perform "Buckeye Battle Cry," the National Anthem and "Go U Northwestern." The Ohio State University Marching Band's halftime show includes a cartoon medley featuring theme songs from Looney Tunes, Jetsons, Mighty Mouse, Mickey Mouse, and others. The halftime show continues with "Under the Sea" and "Somewhere Out There." The Northwestern University Marching Band's halftime performances include "Ya Gotta Try" and "The Planets."

description: The Northwestern Univeristy presents the NU Jazz Concert with the NU Jazz Ensemble and the NU Jazz Lab Band. Part One features the NU Jazz Lab Band conducted by Paul Harshman and includes performances of "Uncle Heavy's pork cup review," "I remember Clifford," and "Spinning wheel." Part Two features the NU Jazz Ensemble, conducted by Don Owens, and includes performances of "Music for jazz ensemble" by Morgan Powell, a piece written by Bill Potts, and two other pieces. The concert was filmed as part of a "remote TV class" at Columbia College.

abstract: Bainum worked as a high school and junior college band instructor before becoming a professor of music, Director of Bands, and Director of the glee clubs at Northwestern University in 1926. Bainum retired in 1953. The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Boxes 1-12 and 22-27 of the collection are divided into ten series: Biographical, Correspondence, Northwestern University School of Music, Other Organizations, General, Sheet Music, Photographs, Reel-toReel Recordings, Movies, Oversize Scores, and Artifacts. An addition consists of boxes 13-21.

scope_and_contents: The Glenn Cliffe Bainum Papers fill twenty-seven boxes and span Bainum's life, with the bulk of the papers dating between the 1930s and the 1960s. Most of the materials in this collection consist of correspondence, records and photographs from Bainum's professional life after he arrived at Northwestern. He kept detailed scrapbooks, especially in his early years at Northwestern, of programs and newspaper clippings relating to many of his activities. Information about nearly all of his major career activities is documented in his papers.
series: Glenn Cliffe Bainum (1888-1974) Papers (19/3/7) -- Movies, ca. 1941-1953

description: The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by John P. Paynter, performs during Northwestern University's football game against the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Illinois.  Footage also includes baton twirling by the brother and sister act of Roger and Barbara Kurucz. Also included are scenes of the NU Marching Band boarding buses in Evanston, traveling to Urbana-Champaign, and practicing for the performance. Selections from another game are included after the Northwestern University vs. Illinois game.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Purdue Boilermakers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Halftime performances include "Seems Like Old Times," "Does Anyone Really Know What Time It Is," and "Brotherhood of Man." The NUMB Alums join the band on the field for "When the Saints Go Marching In." Homecoming Grand Marshal Otto Graham is acknowledged and "Alma Mater" is performed.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Minnesota Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The University of Minnesota begins the pregame performances with "Minnesota March," "Battle Hymn of the Republic," and "Minnesota Rouser." Conducted by Dale J. Lonis, the Northwestern University Marching Band's pregame performances include "Minnesota Rouser," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances by the University of Minnesota Marching Band include "Rock Around the Clock," "Shout," and "I Can't Help Falling in Love With You." Northwestern's halftime performances include "Night in Tunisia" and "El Gato Triste." Television coverage of the halftime performance of "El Gato Triste" follows.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Lonis, Dale|Friedmann, Pete|Paynter, John P.|Williams, John, 1932-
description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale J. Lonis, the halftime performance is a tribute to the 1949 Rose Bowl champions from Northwestern. Performances include "1984 Olympic Fanfare," "Kick-off," "California Dreaming," "Everything's Coming Up Roses," and "Memory." The members of the 1948-49 Wildcat football team are honored on the field. John P. Paynter then leads the band in "Alma Mater." Postgame performances include "1984 Olympic Fanfare," "Everything's Coming Up Roses," "Go U Northwestern," and "Alma Mater." Scenes of an outdoor marching band practice follow the game.

contributor: Paynter, John P.|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Marching Band|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Friedmann, Pete|Lonis, Dale|Paynter, John P.|Sousa, John Philip, 1854-1932
description: Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1984 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Syracuse Orangemen at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Before taking the field for the pregame performance, the band gives a preconcert performance inside Dyche Stadium that includes the National Anthem, "Go U Northwestern," "Down the Field," "On Broadway, " and "Ghostbusters." John P. Paynter thanks the visiting high school bands and conducts "Alma Mater." Pregame performances continue on the football field as the Northwestern Marching Band performs "Down the Field," the National Anthem, "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern. High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a halftime performance that includes "Semper Fidelis," "National Emblem," "America the Beautiful," and "Alma Mater." The Lincoln-Way Community High School Knights Marching Band performs "Celebration Overture." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Before taking the field for the pregame performance, the band gives a preconcert performance inside Dyche Stadium that includes the National Anthem, "On Broadway, " and "Go U Northwestern." Pregame performances continue on the football field as the band performs "Indiana Fight," the National Anthem, "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern.

description: Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Ohio State Buckeyes at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include the National Anthem, "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances from parent weekend during the game versus Ohio State feature songs by George and Ira Gershwin including "Summertime," "Man I Love," "I've Got Rhythm," and "Rhapsody in Blue." John P. Paynter conducts the band for "Alma Mater." Halftime performances from the game versus Illinois include "Yankee Doodle Dandy," "You're a Grand Old Flag," "Georgia On My Mind," and "Sing, Sing, Sing." Postgame performances follow the game versus Illinois.
